title: Mrstacy
author: Mrstacy
content: Asking $3,000 in BTC btc payable to this address 3B6mTzHRn7NATpfu7PzJtvUFwvPMybkWJoThese packs are extremely hot and limited (only 2023 made).  Each pack has guaranteed Refractor.  20 packs will likely get 4 #d/3.Unwrap the magic of the season with the CURRENCY Holiday Mini Set from CARDSMITHS. It’s that special time of year when the hustle and bustle of the holidays is a cornerstone of the economy. This festive set showcases a gallery of classic holiday characters and iconography that really pays off in merriment. Look for crypto trading cards adorned in seasonal garb, gleaming Gemstone Refractor™ cards, and the introduction of the Snowflake Gemstone Refractor™.In fact, your odds of finding a Gemstone Refractor™ have never been better, as there is one of these very popular serial-numbered cards in every Currency Holiday 2023 Pack! Of course, no Currency trading card set would be complete without the chance of finding a cryptocurrency redemption card.  So, we’ve randomly inserted a total of 21 redemption cards in these holiday packs for various Bitcoin denominations from 0.001 up to 0.1 BTC!There may even be a few surprises in store with these packs! What are you waiting for?  Get invested in the yuletide spirit with this special holiday edition of CURRENCY Trading Cards.Pack Odds:Collector Parallel Snowflake Holofoil 1:1, Serial-Numbered Gemstone Refractor™ 1:1, Cryptocurrency Redemption 1:96

comments.author: StorageCold
comments.body: Doesn't seem too valuable based off of the sentiment. Most are trying to sell their Holiday cards for profit instead of collecting. Seems more like a shitcoin money printing event for Cardsmiths Currency.

comments.author: Mrstacy
comments.body: Quote from: StorageCold on December 13, 2023, 09:16:42 PMDoesn't seem too valuable based off of the sentiment. Most are trying to sell their Holiday cards for profit instead of collecting. Seems more like a shitcoin money printing event for Cardsmiths Currency.Cardsmiths was a bit sneaky in that they used Series 1 and 2 characters in the holiday release.   This causes the hodlers to want them to complete their sets.  For 1/1s collectors have paid several thousands of dollars.   So a #d/3, they may have no problem shelling out 750+ I'm guessing. One pack already sold for $130+.https://www.ebay.com/itm/225914448857?mkcid=16&mkevt=1&mkrid=711-127632-2357-0&ssspo=2euQuwRkSCe&sssrc=4429486&ssuid=rqqYryMZRqa&var=&widget_ver=artemis&media=COPY

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Quote from: Mrstacy on December 14, 2023, 04:31:13 PMHere's a peak at new #d/3 card.https://www.ebay.com/itm/256341527373?mkcid=16&mkevt=1&mkrid=711-127632-2357-0&ssspo=YelCd2PkSzy&sssrc=4429486&ssuid=rqqYryMZRqa&var=&widget_ver=artemis&media=COPYId bet it wont sell anywhere close to this price. Heres  the problem with these holiday card prices. I get that these cards are rare, but dont forget they dumped 2100 refractors out in one week. The supply of holiday cards is through the roof. These prices may stick after next summer. Regarding Mr Stacy's deal. I think its a reasonable price. If you were selling individual packs for $100 i might be down, but $3000 at Christmas is too much for me. If no takers, maybe consider selling individually.
